item.title: Help with theif shooting game
item.dc:creator: @Arkanor Arkanor
item.description:
@Arkanor wrote:

[code]program ThiefKiller;
{An Arkanor Production}
var
x,y:integer;

begin
activateclient;
wait(500);
clickmouse(247,180,true);
wait(500);
repeat
if(findcolor(x,y,10996476,6,7,497,319))or (findcolor(x,y,8760826,6,7,497,319))then //8760826
clickmouse(x+random(5),y+random(52),true);
wait(450);
until(getcolor(271,194)=255);
writeln(‘Game over, man. Game over.’);
end.[/code]

Works sort of well. I think that the colors are a little bit hard to do here, plus you can still shoot the thieves after they are ‘dead’. That makes it gay and harder to code for.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with theif shooting game
item.dc:creator: @KyleGut3 KyleGut3
item.description:
@KyleGut3 wrote:

Here, this one works a little better, but it still needs some more [if anyone else wants to work on it lol]

{#####################################)
(## URL: Declined To Me x.x         ##)
(##                                 ##)
(##    Script Made By KyleGut3      ##)
(##                                 ##)
(## Instructions:                   ##)
(## Select The Game Window And Run  ##)
(#####################################}


program TheifShooter;
{.include squig2.txt}

Var
 x,y :integer;

Const
 tcolor1=8760826; //Don't change
                            //all points minus 7,7
procedure Check1;
begin
 if(FindColor(x,y,tcolor1,100,55,150,70))then
 begin
  MouseC(x,y,1);
 end;
end;

procedure Check2;
begin
 if(FindColor(x,y,tcolor1,207,0,300,700))then
 begin
  MouseC(x,y,1);
 end;
end;

procedure Check3;
begin
 if(FindColor(x,y,tcolor1,165,228,200,255))then
 begin
  MouseC(x,y,1);
 end;
end;

procedure Check4;
begin
 if(FindColor(x,y,tcolor1,390,170,450,230))then
 begin
  MouseC(x,y,1);
 end;
end;

procedure Check5;
begin
 if(FindColor(x,y,tcolor1,300,280,450,310))then
 begin
  MouseC(x,y,1);
 end;
end;

procedure Check6;
begin
 if(FindColor(x,y,tcolor1,460,290,500,320))then
 begin
  MouseC(x,y,1);
 end;
end;

begin
 repeat
  Check1;
  Check2;
  Check3;
  Check4;
  Check5;
  Check6;
 until(False);
end.

item.title: Help with theif shooting game
item.dc:creator: @xxhellfirexx xxhellfirexx
item.description:
@xxhellfirexx wrote:

[code]{#####################################)
(## URL: Declined To Me x.x ##)
(## ##)
(## Script Made By KyleGut3 ##)
(## ##)
(## Instructions: ##)
(## Select The Game Window And Run, ##)
(#####################################}

program ClickNow;
{.include squig2.txt}

Var
x,y :integer;

Const
tcolor1=4546664; //Don’t change

procedure KillTarget;
begin
if(FindColor(x,y,tcolor1,1,1,550,400))then
begin
Clickmouse(x,y,true);
end;

End;

Begin
Repeat
KillTarget;
Until(False);
End.[/code]’

This code works perfectly fine however it only clicks on one theif a billion times. Can someone pls modify the code so it works like a hit the gopher game where it clicks on the gopher once and goes around clicking the other ones until the onces that have been clicked comes up again?

Read full topic
